name: Enhanced SMS Conversation
description: This module mimics the built-in REDCap SMS survey conversation but adds more flexibility around reminders, expiration, and custom context based on event/instance.

crons.cron_description: This cron will run once a minute to check whether a reminder or expiry needs to go out to any existing conversations

project-settings.name:
Phone Field
Field containing the participants phone number validated as a phone number.

Phone Field Event
If project is longitudinal, please select the event containing the phone field

Reminder Text
(optional) If set to a value, conversations will be sent a reminder after this number of minutes without a response. The counter restarts after each participant response.

Missing Text Reminder
After the allowed reminder time has elapsed, this message will be included in the reminder message in this format.

Expire Conversations
(optional) If set to a value, conversations will expire after this number of minutes without a response. If blank, the conversation/survey will never expire. To decrease server load, we recommend setting an expiration, even if it is very large

Default Expiry Text
If an active conversation expires, this message will be sent to the user.

Thursday Expiry Text
After the allowed expiry time for the Thursday survey has elapsed, this message will be sent to the user.

Sunday Expiry Text
After the allowed expiry time for the Sunday survey has elapsed, this message will be sent to the user.

Default Nonsense Text Warning

Upon receipt of a text that does not match an expected response, this message will be included in the reply message in this format.

This value can be overridden on a per-question basis using the actiontag, e.g. @ESMS-INVALID-RESPONSE="You must enter a number between 5 and 10"

No Open Conversation Message

(optional) If a participant sends a SMS message when no conversation/survey is open, this message, if defined, will be sent in reply. A good value might be: No surveys are currently available. Please wait until your next invitation or contact the study team. Your responses are not actively monitored.

SMS Opt Out field
This must be a checkbox field with an option of '1, Opted Out'. If unchecked, the participant is assumed to be available. If checked, the participant has opted out and messages will no longer be delivered. A participant can opt-out by replying with 'STOP' or 'OPT-OUT' and can opt back into messaging by replying with 'START'

SMS Opt Out field Event ID
If project is longitudinal, please select the event containing the SMS Opt Out field

Study Withdrawn Logic
(Optional) If specified, this LOGICAL EXPRESSION will be evaluated prior to sending outbound messages. If the result is TRUE, the participant is deemed to be withdrawn from the study and outbound messages will not be sent. Stopping SMS does not necessarily withdraw person from study. If longitudinal, be sure to include event info in the logical expression.
e.g.[event_1_arm_1][calc_withdrawn]='1'

Disable Outgoing Twilio SMS
(optional) If checked, module will prevent ALL outbound SMS messages for this project regardless of record opt-out status

Disable Incoming Twilio SMS
(optional) If checked, module will not process inbound twilio messages

Enable Debug Logging
(optional) Requires installation and configuration of emLogger

system-settings.name: Ignore Cron (system-wide)(optional) If checked, we will not run the cron method
Enable Debug Logging (system-wide)(optional) Requires installation and configuration of emLogger
